other_tests.findings: Z scores at the spine (L2 â€“L4) were -2.40 and -2.66 for patients D2 and D1, respectively; whole-body bone mineral content Z scores were -0.47 and -1.59.
Identified a heterozygous nucleotide substitution T410R in the PTH/PTHrP receptor gene.
Elevated urinary calcium excretion in both children.
Findings compatible with nephrolithiasis in patient D1.
Both patients were found to be slightly below the third percentile for height, with significant genu valgum and widening of the metaphyseal areas of long bones.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patient D2 developed kidney stones at age 7, and patient D1 presented with painful gross hematuria at age 7.5.

other_tests.findings: Generalized osteopenia and symmetric bowing of the long bones, mainly affecting the lower limbs.
